III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/11/25, a youth was acting up and restrained. The youth was
swung into the wall by an unknown staff member and sustained a
laceration to the forehead.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 5/13/25. Complainant
did not provide any additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 5/13/25. Youth was observed to have a
purple and red mark above his right eye partially covered by a
white bandage. Youth A reported he was messing around with
Staff 1 by jumping on the desk. Youth A reported Staff 1 pulled
him off the desk by his clothing multiple times and one of the times
he fell to the floor. Youth A reported he was trying to calm down
and Staff 1 was yelling at him, making it hard to do so. Youth A did
not remember what Staff 1 was saying. Youth A reported he was
yelling back at Staff 1 and then tried to get to the phone. Youth A
reported he took the phone logbook from the desk and Staff 1
grabbed him while attempting to grab the book from him and she
slammed his head into the door frame. Youth A reported no other
staff were around. Youth A reported other youth around were
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D. Youth A reported he did not
sustain any other injuries. Youth A reported he was bleeding so
Staff 1 brought him a towel and then he was taken to see a nurse.
Youth A reported he had his head glued shut.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 5/13/25. Youth B reported he was in his
room at the time of the incident. Youth B reported Youth A was
jumping on the counter and a staff was telling him to get down
multiple times. Youth B reported the staff pulled him off the
counter by grabbing him. Youth B could not recall which staff it
2

was and could not remember if other staff were around. Youth B
reported Youth A was bleeding at one point and believed it was
from when he hit his head when the staff pulled him off the
counter. Youth B could not recall any further details including how
Staff 1 pulled or grabbed Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 5/13/25. Youth C reported Youth A was
tripping out while Staff 1 was telling him to calm down. Youth C
reported Youth A was jumping up on the desk and he grabbed the
phone logbook. Youth C reported Staff 1 was trying to get the
logbook back by following him and grabbing it. Youth C reported
the next thing he knew Youth A was bleeding. Youth C denied
seeing how Youth A started bleeding and denied any other staff
being nearby. Youth C reported Staff 1 was pulling Youth A by his
clothing multiple times to get off the counter.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 5/13/25. Youth D reported Youth A was
jumping on the counters and punching the wall. Youth D reported
the staff was telling him to get down and to stop. Youth D reported
there was a male staff there towards the end who he does not
know the name of. Youth D reported Staff 1 put Youth A in a PRT
hold and Youth A smacked his head on the wall by the door.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 5/13/25. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
agitated and was getting onto the counters. Staff 1 reported she
verbally directed him to get down several times and he would not
listen. Staff 1 reported being the only staff on the pod. Staff 1
reported Youth A was grabbing the logbook and when she was
attempting to get it from him, he swung into the door frame. Staff 1
reported Youth A was bleeding from hitting his head on the door
frame. Staff 1 denied restraining Youth A, elaborating she had her
hands on the logbook at the same time Youth A did and in the
struggle for it Youth A hit his head. Staff 1 denied touching Youth
A at any time during the escalation. Staff 1 denied Youth A asking
to use the phone until after Youth A began pacing around and was
escalated. Staff 1 reported when the situation calmed she would
allow Youth A to use the phone.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility along with
MDHHS Specialist on 5/22/25. Supervisor reported approaching
the area after the incident occurred. Supervisor reported Youth A
was bleeding from his head at the time. Supervisor reported Youth
A was stating he was pushed into the wall by Staff 1. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 was sent off the floor. Supervisor could not recall
3

what other staff or youth were present when he approached other
than Youth D.
Staff 2 was interviewed by phone along with MDHHS Specialist
on 6/11/2025. Staff 2 reported approaching the pod at the time of
the incident to change the channel on the TV when Staff 1 was
having issues with Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A was asking
to use the phone and Staff 1 was not letting him at the time. Staff
2 reported asking Staff 1 why Youth A could not use the phone
and Staff 2 could not recall if Staff 1 responded to his question.
Staff 2 reported Youth A went behind the counter at which time
Staff 1 became upset and appeared to be the aggressor, stating
that when Youth A grabbed the phone logbook Staff 1 snatched
Youth A with her hands and swung him around and into the door
frame causing his head to bleed. Staff 2 denied any proper
restraint techniques being implemented.
Video Review:
• Video footage from 5/11/25 Pod 1D was viewed. Video
footage shows Youth A getting onto the counter multiple
times and each time Staff 1 is shown grabbing Youth A by
his clothing and pulling him down off the counter and onto
the ground. Video footage shows Youth A pacing and Staff
1 following closely and speaking to him. At 2 minutes and
10 seconds into video footage shows Youth A walk behind
the counter and Staff 1 wrapping her arms around him and
pulling him out of the area. Youth A then begins to punch
the wall. Staff 1 attempts to stop Youth A from punching the
wall by reaching her arms up and placing her hands on
Youth A’s arms. At 2 minutes 38 seconds Youth A walks
behind the counter and sits on the desk when Staff 1
follows, reaches her arms and grabs hold of Youth A by his
clothes and left shoulder and pulls him out from behind the
counter towards the door. Youth A and Staff 1 are both
positioned facing the left side of the door frame when Staff
1 adjusts her grip on the logbook and Youth A falls forward
hitting his head on the door frame. Youth A bends over
when blood is seen dripping from his head.
Documents Reviewed:
• Nursing Note dated 5/11/25 documents a laceration on the
forehead was treated.
• Physical Management Policy documents only Handle with
Care interventions may be utilized in necessary situations
for safety of youth in the facility. Policy states all staff are to
follow guidelines by the State of Michigan Licensing Rules.
4

• Incident Report (IR) dated 5/11/25 documents Youth A
sustained a laceration to the forehead from hitting it. IR
documents that Staff 1 was attempting to deescalate Youth
A when there was a struggle over the logbook and Youth A
hit his head.
• Training Record for Staff 1 documents 149.5 hours of
completed training including Handle with Care and
Verbal/Physical Intervention.
Analysis A rule violation is established regarding this licensing rule. It was
reported and supported via video footage that Youth A was pulled
off the counter by Staff 1 by his clothing multiple times. It was also
reported and supported via video footage Staff 1 attempted
multiple improper restraints by grabbing Youth A and pulling him.
Following an attempted improper restraint video footage shows
Staff 1 and Youth A struggling over the logbook resulting in Youth
A’s injury.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
